content.description:
The  Dog  class contains a non-static  method named  calculateWalkLength  which can be called from a class other than  Dog.  The method takes an integer parameter for the number of minutes a dog is taken for a walk and returns a  double  representing the number of miles walked during that time.

The following code segment appears in a class other than  Dog.  The statement in line 2 causes a compile-time error.Dog fido = new Dog(); // line 1
double miles = calculateWalkLength(fido, 90); // line 2
content.question: Which of the following can be used to replace line 2 so that this code segment will compile without error?

skill.text: 3.D: Explain why a code segment will not compile or work as intended and modify the code to correct the error.
